feed.title: Google Cloud: Firestore
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Firestore

entry.content:
You can now use the Firestore remote MCP server. The Firestore remote MCP server lets you interact with documents stored in a Firestore database from your AI application.

This feature is in Preview.
entry.summary: You can now use the Firestore remote MCP server to interact with documents stored in a Firestore database from your AI application. This feature is currently in Preview.
entry.title: Feature: Interact with Firestore from AI apps

entry.content:
The Firestore databases page in the Google Cloud console now includes a status column. Possible statuses include:

  • Ready
  • Cloning is in progress
  • Restoring from backup is in progress
  • Deleted
  • Failed

For the cloning and restore statuses, the status column updates upon completion.
entry.summary: The Firestore databases page now displays a status column, showing statuses like Ready, Cloning, Restoring, Deleted, or Failed. This provides better visibility into your database's current state and ongoing operations.
entry.title: Feature: New Firestore Database Statuses

entry.content:
Firestore Enterprise edition now supports Native mode and the Pipeline operations interface.

Pipeline operations are a new query interface for Firestore. This interface provides advanced query functionality that includes complex expressions. It also adds support for many new functions like min, max, substring, regex_match and array_contains_all.

With Firestore Enterprise edition in Native mode, index creation is also completely optional, streamlining the process of developing new queries.

To learn more about Pipeline operations, see the query interfaces overview.

This feature is available in Preview.
entry.summary: Firestore Enterprise Edition now supports Native mode and the new Pipeline operations interface, offering advanced query capabilities and optional index creation for a streamlined development experience. This preview feature includes new functions like min, max, and regex_match.
entry.title: Feature: Firestore Enterprise Edition Enhancements

entry.summary: We now support Object as a document _id identifier.
entry.title: Feature: Object ID Support

entry.content: The database clone feature is now supported at the General Availability (GA) level.
entry.summary: The database clone feature is now supported at the General Availability (GA) level. This feature allows for easier management of databases.
entry.title: Feature: Database Clone Feature Now Generally Available

entry.content: You can now query your databases and update data using the dedicated Gemini CLI extension for Firestore. This feature is available in beta.
entry.summary: Query and update your data using the new Gemini CLI extension for Firestore. Available in beta.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini CLI extension for Firestore

entry.content: Use Query insights to view query performance metrics for your database. This feature is now generally available (GA).
entry.summary: Query insights for Firestore are now generally available. You can use this feature to view query performance metrics for your database.
entry.title: Feature: Query insights now GA

entry.content: You can clone an existing database at a selected timestamp into a new database. This feature is available in Preview.
entry.summary: Clone your existing database to a new database.
entry.title: Feature: Clone Database
